resources.string: This is a game of Tic Tac Toe with a twist. You\'ve probably played Tic Tac Toe before. \n\tThe original goal of the game is for the player to place three of their marks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row.\n

Similar to traditional tic-tac-toe, 3d-tic-tac-toe is played in just as the traditional version but this time in a cubical array of cells. 
	The winning row can be horizontal, vertical, or diagonal on a single board as in regular tic-tac-toe, or vertically in a column, or a diagonal line through three boards.
	 Bellow are a few examples of successful 3-in-a-row placements in a 3d-tic-tac-toe game.

\nPerhaps after a few games, you realise that the game can be very easily won by the player who first takes the middle core spot. So let\'s increase the challenge by locking that space from both players. \n\tAnd while we\'re at it let\'s lock a few more spaces, but this time, randomly, in order to add a little unpredictability to the game.

Finally, we arrive at the real purpose of the game: increasing your inteligence and visual representations. In other words: your visual imagination and visual memory. 
	 After you get accustomed to the game, the challenge is to play it (and consistently win) without any visual aids representing the 3d matrix. You will only place your moves with the text based interface you see bellow. 
	 The 3d matrix will only be in you head!!!
So that\'s it. Good luck and have fun!
